page.title: 01PART OF ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: This South East corner of Ashdown Forest is in an Area of Special Scientific Interest within the Sussex Weald Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Our patch of the Forest is roughly saucer-shaped, rising to a height of 220 metres to the East and l75 metres to the West and dropping down to lOO metres towards the centre. Heathland with occasional pine clumps occupy the South and East, while the centre and North West are privately owned estates of farms and woods. Apart from these estates almost the whole of our area is common land to which the public have right of access.One B road runs down the Eastern quarter, but the area is also easily accessible to the South and West, where it lies just off the main Eastbourne to London road.
